Dockside Restaurant & Bar Skip to main content Menu HOME MENU RESERVATIONS WEDDINGS FUNCTIONS Upstairs Restaurant Private Room Main Deck CONTACT facebook instagram phone email Press enter to begin your search Search Close Search With one of the largest outdoor dining areas over water in the Southern Hemisphere, it would be difficult to find a better venue to enjoy Wellington’s waterfront. Taking into account Wellington’s unpredictable weather, the deck can be covered with a large retractable roof whilst still offering the superb feeling of Al Fresco dining. Dockside operates under a ‘Supervised’ Liquor License, meaning all minors (under 18 years of age) must be accompanied by their own parent or legal guardian at all times. Book Now Restaurant Our aim is to offer the best New Zealand cuisine, with the freshest & finest local produce available. OUR MENUS Functions If you have a group of 12 or more, or any special requests, please click here to get in touch! FUNCTION ROOMS Weddings Like and follow our Facebook page to keep up to date with our latest events & special offers! WEDDING INFO A Little Of Our history Shed 3 Dockside Restaurant & Bar was established in 1991 in this historic wooden building known as Shed 3. The history of our beautiful building dates back to 1887 and is now listed as a heritage site by Wellington City Council. It is one of the oldest examples of a building fundamental to operating Wellington’s wharves. Originally a single-storey warehouse, a second storey was added in the 20th century for Harbour Board tug boat staff. Timber buildings like this one once lined the wharves and jetties between Taranaki Street and Pipitea Wharf. Now, Shed 3 is one of the last remaining few. Testimonials “ I visited Dockside during my holiday from the UK and was amazed by the quality of the produce and service from the attentive staff. Very warm and sincere welcome and nothing too much trouble. Quality of the food was very high and cooked to perfection. I was so pleased with the steak I got in fact I would say it’s the best steak I have ever eaten. . . .perfection on a plate. Dessert followed and was equally as good. The prices were fine and the position of the restaurant on the quay is superb. I thoroughly recommend this restaurant/bar and it’s excellent value for money. ” Mark R Fantastic “ We had bad Dinning experience across the road that night before coming to dockside, we arrived at dockside after wow show on busy Saturday night and host offered us table upstairs, our table was ready near bar but we requested manager to get sea view table and he arranged that for us within few minutes to make our experience more enjoyable and our waitress was very friendly and attentive and helped us in recommending dishes, food was awesome especially sharing platter and steak!!!!! Perfectly cooked 10/10, service 10/10, location 10/10. ” Paige After WOW “ We booked our table as we were sure dockside will be definitely busy for wow weekend, we arrived early and had some drinks at bar downstairs been sent upstairs by gentleman and we been taken over to our table and menu was quite interesting so all of us decided to have 3 courses but was not too sure if we can finish it off before 7:30 pm as they were many tables eating, but our waiter was on fire he took our order in few minutes and entree we received within few minutes & rest of 2 courses were on time as well and everyone at our table enjoyed 3 courses & totally satisfied with Food and Service, our bill was taken on our table by manager to save our time and avoid queue line. Thank you josh and dixey for such great manakitanga. ” Pablo Fantastic Time at Dockside “ Visited Dockside first time with family just before show our table was ready upstairs, the restaurant was totally full was not to sure if we can attend our show, once we seated our order was taken by french waitress and she was very friendly and our meals were top notch being super busy service standards and food quality was very high of dockside. Definitely coming back here again for Great food and service. Highly Recommend Red Capsicum, lamb, chocolate tarte ” Tylah Absolutely Wow!!! “ We visited for my birthday without a booking, I mentioned it was my birthday and I wanted a nice table, but I didn't expect the dessert coming out decorated that make an already amazing time more amazing, meals were so delicious great price excellent service an absolute gem! ” Ainsleed A million out of ten Reservation Please give us a call on (04) 499 9900 or email us at dine@docksidenz.com Dockside Restaurant & Bar Shed 3 Queens Wharf Wellington New Zealand T: (04) 499 9900 E: dine@docksidenz.com © 2025 Dockside.co.nz. facebook instagram phone email Close Menu HOME MENU RESERVATIONS WEDDINGS FUNCTIONS Upstairs Restaurant Private Room Main Deck CONTACT facebook instagram phone email

BlueWater Marinas About Our Experience Team Contact About Our Experience Team Contact Connect With Us BlueWater Marinas: A Cut Above the Rest BlueWater’s management team is one of the most experienced in the sector with over 110 years of combined experience dedicated to developing, redeveloping, managing, and maximizing value of marina operations. BlueWater will be opportunistic, relying on its long-standing relationships, successful track record, and experience in the space to assemble a best-in-class portfolio of irreplaceable marinas in high barrier-to-entry markets. Our Experience Management Team BlueWater's principals and management team were the former founders and management teams of Atlantic Marina Holdings ("AMH") and PORT32 Marinas ("P32") and have over 110 years combined experience in the industry. Read More Acquisition History Since 2003, BlueWater's principals have acquired, developed and managed over 4,000 wet and dry slips and over 140,000 square feet of marine commercial space. Read More Proven Track Record BlueWater's management team has consistently delivered exceptional risk adjusted returns for its investors and will continue to rely on its deep industry relationships to maximize the value for its investors. Read More // Meet The Team The BlueWater Team 0 / 0 Read Bio + - Joe H Miller IV Founder & Principal Joe H Miller IV is a Principal and co-founder of BlueWater Marinas. Joe has over 30 years of experience in the real estate industry and for the past 20 years has been a leading participant in the marina industry. Previously, Joe founded and grew two marina companies, Atlantic Marina Holdings and Port 32 Marinas. With over $500 million in marina transaction and development activity under Joe’s leadership, his previous companies assembled a best-in-class portfolio totaling over 4,000 slips across the Southeast. Prior to entering the marina industry, Joe started his career in the real estate industry in 1990 working for Trammell Crow Company, Childress Klein Properties and Cousins Properties in Atlanta before venturing out on his own to start Miller Development in 1998 in Charleston. Joe earned his J.D. from the University of South Carolina and his MBA from the Fuqua School of Business at Duke University. Read Bio + - Dunston Powell, CCIM Principal Dunston Powell is a Principal and co-founder of BlueWater Marinas. Dunston has a BS in Real Estate from the University of Georgia and received a CCIM designation in 2002. Dunston has been fully vested in commercial real estate investing, brokerage and development since 1996. Prior to forming BlueWater Marinas, LLC, Dunston was Chief Investment Officer at Port 32 Marinas, owned and operated three successful boutique commercial/investment real estate firms, and was Director of Acquisitions at Atlantic Marina Holdings. Dunston has been involved in over $500 million in marina transactions. Dunston is an active member of Holy Cross Episcopal Church, CCIM, Association of Marina Industries, Autism Speaks, driver for Meals on Wheels, and is a past president for Mt. Pleasant Sertoma Charity. Additional deals participated in outside of AMH & P32 Ownership: Tidewater Yacht Marina – Portsmouth VA – 300 wet slips Magwood Marine – Mount Pleasant SC – 70 dry slips Simmons Marina – Mount Pleasant SC – 70 dry slips Seabreeze Marina – Charleston SC – 200 dry/50 wet slips Golden Isles Marina – St Simons GA – 250 dry slips Timberlake Marina – Chapin SC - 220 wet slips Read Bio + - Joe H Miller V Managing Director Joe H Miller V is a Managing Director and a co-founder of BlueWater Marinas. In Joe’s role, he oversees day-to-day corporate activities, including acquisitions and asset management, and will oversee all future developments. Prior to BlueWater, Joe was the Director of Acquisitions and Development at Port 32 Marinas. Prior to joining Port 32 Marinas, Joe spent two and half years at Greystar, the nation’s largest multifamily developer. While at Greystar, he was involved in the development of over a $1 billion of residential multi-family deals totaling over 2,000 units. Prior to Greystar, Joe spent two years with JBG Smith, a market leader in the commercial and multi-family industries in the DC metro area. Joe was involved in nearly $500 million of development, including a 280,000 SF office tower where JBGS re-located their headquarters and over 600 multifamily units. Joe holds a BA from the University of Virginia and a Masters in Real Estate and Infrastructure from the Johns Hopkins Carey Business School. Read Bio + - Josh Schooler Director of Finance Josh Schooler joined BlueWater Marinas in 2023 and serves as the Director of Finance for the company. Josh’s primary responsibilities include oversight on all company and property finances, investor financial reporting and annual budgeting. Prior to BlueWater, Josh spent four years at Greystar, the nation’s largest multifamily developer. While there, he worked as the accounting manager over the Carolinas region, overseeing all development and construction in both South Carolina and North Carolina. His role consisted of maintaining regional financial reporting and FP&A on nearly $800M in residential multi-family asset value consisting of over 4,000 individual units, along with financial oversight on 25+ development projects between active construction and fully operational assets. Josh received his BS in Accounting and Masters in Accounting from Clemson University and currently holds his CPA license in South Carolina. Read Bio + - Cam Melangton Director of Operations Cam Melangton joined BlueWater in 2024 and serves as Director of Operations. Cam’s primary responsibilities include facility management transition, staff training, infrastructure maintenance, dock & pier reconstruction, emergency response, guest services, facility branding, fueling operations, electrical & pump out systems, and submerged land leases. Cam has over a decade of marina management experience overseeing multiple facilities, specializing in optimizing operations and financial performance. Cam holds his AMI and CMM certifications. Read Bio + - Rebecca McMenemy Director of Marketing & Business Operations Rebecca McMenemy joined BlueWater in 2023 and serves as Director of Marketing and Business Operations. Rebecca has over 17 years of experience in the marine industry, having started her career with Atlantic Marina Holdings. Rebecca’s primary responsibilities include company-wide marketing, branding & merchandising, due diligence and acquisitions integration, HR strategy & employee relations, and software & technology management. Prior to joining Bluewater, Rebecca worked in the same capacity at Port 32 Marinas. Rebecca received her BS from the College of Charleston. Read Bio + - Shane Marler Director of Operations- South Carolina Shane Marler joined BlueWater in 2024 and serves as Director of Operations for its South Carolina assets. Shane’s primary responsibilities include marina operations management, staffing and training, infrastructure and equipment maintenance, emergency response, and advising on due diligence, including operations, physical plant, and equipment. Shane is an OSHA-Certified Forklift Operator. Prior to joining Bluewater, Shane worked in the same capacity at Atlantic Marina Holdings since 2004. Shane received his BS from Francis Marion University. Read Bio + - Jared Young Controller Jared Young joined BlueWater Marinas in 2025 and serves as the Controller for the company. Jared’s primary responsibilities include oversight of daily accounting operations, investor reporting, and regional portfolio consolidation of assets under ownership. Prior to joining BlueWater, Jared spent five years at Greystar, the nation’s largest multifamily developer. While at Greystar, he managed the development and construction accounting for the Phoenix and Las Vegas Markets. Jared received his BS and Masters in Accounting from Clemson University and is a licensed CPA in South Carolina. Read Bio + - Campbell Miller Senior Investment Associate Campbell Miller is a Senior Investment Associate at BlueWater Marinas. In his role, he oversees asset management across the portfolio and leads underwriting on all potential acquisitions. He joined BlueWater at its inception in 2022 and has been integral in the company’s growth and investment strategy. Prior to BlueWater, Campbell spent three years at Port 32 Marinas, where he assisted in the company’s recapitalization during his first year and served as the lead analyst and underwriter as the platform expanded from 4 to 9 assets totaling $400 million in value. Campbell holds a BA in Economics from the University of Virginia and a Master’s in Real Estate from Georgetown’s McDonough School of Business. Read Bio + - Sam Miller Associate - Acquisitions & Leasing Sam Miller joined BlueWater Marinas at the company’s inception in 2022 and serves as an Associate for the company. Sam’s primary responsibilities include assisting on all new acquisitions, leading the firm’s commercial leasing activity and performing market research. Prior to BlueWater, Sam worked as an Associate in this same capacity at Port 32 Marinas, which he joined in April 2021. Sam holds a Masters in Real Estate from Georgetown University and graduated from the University of Virginia with a BA in History. After UVA, he worked for the U.S. Department of Commerce as an assistant to the CFO for two years. Read Bio + - George Shepherd Senior Analyst George Shepherd joined BlueWater Marinas in 2025 and serves as a Senior Analyst. He is responsible for financial analysis, modeling, creating investment materials, and supporting acquisitions and developments. His work focuses on driving the company’s strategic initiatives in both acquisitions and asset management. Before joining BlueWater, George worked at Greystar within the Investment Management team, where he supported multifamily and build-for-rent acquisitions and asset management across Southeast U.S. markets. George holds a BA in Economics and a master’s in commerce from the University of Virginia. Prior to his role at Greystar, he completed a summer internship at Brand Properties in his hometown of Atlanta, GA. Read Bio + - Sawyer Umstead Acquisitions Associate Sawyer Umstead is an Acquisitions Associate at BlueWater Marinas, where he is responsible for sourcing and evaluating marina investment opportunities along the East Coast, with a strong focus on New England. His primary responsibilities include deal sourcing, leading due diligence processes, conducting market research, and implementing value-add and development initiatives across BlueWater’s portfolio of marinas. Before moving into his current role, Sawyer joined BlueWater as an Analyst in June 2024 after interning with the company earlier that year while completing his MBA at the College of Charleston. He also holds a BS in Economics from East Carolina University. Read Bio + - Zoe Gage Associate- Marketing & Business Operations Zoe Gage joined BlueWater Marinas in April 2024 and serves as an Associate of Marketing and Business Operations for the company. Zoe’s primary responsibilities include assisting on implementation of marina level business plans, overseeing  internal and external marketing objectives, aiding in HR operations, and administrative tasks. Prior to BlueWater, Zoe worked in digital marketing and creative recruiting. She also maintains her UX Design certificate from General Assembly. Zoe holds her BA in Advertising and Communication Studies from the University of Georgia. Marina Portfolio Boathouse Marine Center // Owned The BlueWater management team acquired Boathouse Marine Center in April 2025. Boathouse Marine Center is located along Federal Highway in Pompano Beach, FL — the heart of the U.S. boating capital in Broward County — offering direct access to the Atlantic Ocean and Intracoastal Waterway, making it a premier destination for boating and fishing. Boathouse Marine Center offers indoor dry storage for boats up to 42 feet, as well as a full service department. Glyn's Marine // Owned The BlueWater management team acquired Glyn’s Marine in July 2025. Founded over 40 years ago, Glyn’s Marine has built a strong reputation for providing comprehensive marine services on Nantucket , including dry boat storage, launching, hauling, winterizing, spring conditioning, outboard service, hull maintenance/repairs, outboard and boat sales, and mooring ball maintenance Harbor at Lemon Bay // Owned The BlueWater management team acquired the Harbor at Lemon Bay in November 2024. Lemon Bay is a boutique dry storage facility located in Englewood, FL near Manasota Key, conveniently located between Venice and Boca Grande. The hidden gem offers indoor storage for boats up to 40 feet, along with fuel services and easy access to both the Gulf of Mexico and the Intracoastal Waterway. With its prime location, Lemon Bay is the perfect launching point for exploring Boca Grande, Charlotte Harbor, Pine Island Sound, Cabbage Key, and Captiva Island. thehalb.com Ripley Light Marina // Managed The BlueWater Management team acquired Ripley Light Marina in 2004, the second marina facility purchased by the founders of BlueWater. Ripley Light is located on the Ashely River directly across from downtown Charleston and has been in operation since 1988. The marina offers 220 dry slips and a fuel dock. ripleylightmarina.com PORT 32 Tampa // Realized The BlueWater management team acquired Port 32 Tampa in 2018. Port 32 Tampa is a modern, class A marina developed in 2007, conveniently located in downtown Tampa. The marina features 600 + dry slips, 40 wet slips, 10,000 square feet of commercial space, swimming pool, a 5,000 square feet dealer & service center, fuel dock and Hula Bay/Duke’s Retired Surfer’s Island Bar, popular local waterfront establishments., Port 32 Tampa is the premier choice for Tampa residents and stands as one of the largest dry storage facilities in the country. PORT 32 Fort Lauderdale // Realized The BlueWater management team acquired the Port 32 Fort Lauderdale site in 2016 with plans to develop a leading marina facility within Marina Mile on the New River. The management team took the site through its full entitlement upon acquisition and the first phase of redevelopment, which focused on rebuilding the yacht basin and adding the only fuel dock on the New River, was completed in 2019. The basin provides approximately 2,000 linear feet of dockage and can accommodate 16 to 32 mega yachts. The second phase, completed in the second quarter of 2023, includes approximately 250 dry slips, roughly 20,000 square feet of commercial space, crew quarters, a dockmaster’s office, and a boatyard spanning approximately 100,000 square feet. The management team entitled the site for up to 700 dry slips allowing the facility flexibility to continue to meet market demand. With its comprehensive redevelopment now complete, Port 32 Fort Lauderdale stands as one of the premier full service marine facilities in the area. PORT 32 Tierra Verde // Realized The BlueWater management team acquired Port 32 Tierra Verde in 2017. Port 32 Tierra Verde is a modern, class A marina redeveloped in 2015, located on the scenic island of Tierra Verde in the southern tip of Pinellas County. The marina consists of approximately 350 dry slips, with a variety of offerings for boats 40 feet and above. Additionally, it offers almost 100 wet slips including lifts, around 10,000 square feet of commercial space, a ship store, 5,800 square foot service center, and a fuel dock. Adjacent to the marina, there is a newly built boutique Marriot Residence Inn, along with Island Grill, an 8,000 square feet restaurant featuring a tiki bar and a shared resort pool. Port 32 Tierra Verde is widely regarded as one of the premier full service marinas on the West Coast of Florida. PORT 32 Naples // Realized The BlueWater management team acquired Port 32 Naples in 2021. Port 32 Naples is a class A, dry storage facility located in the heart of Naples. The marina comprises 680 indoor dry slips. In addition to the dry slips, the site includes a clubhouse with dining options for members, an outdoor pool, a commercial sales and service building leased to OneWater, and a fuel dock. Since its market debut in 2006, this facility has maintained a strong reputation and remains the leading marina in the region. PORT 32 Palm Beach Gardens // Realized Port 32 Palm Beach Gardens has operated as a marina in the heart of Palm Beach Gardens for over half a century, but its forty-year-old barn has recently become obsolete due to the increasing vessel sizes. The BlueWater management team acquired the site in 2015 with plans to modernize the facility into one of the leading state-of-the-art drystack facilities in the country. In 2019, Phase I of the redevelopment was completed with Phase 2 currently in process which aims to completely overhaul the dry storage and commercial components of the marina. Once finished, the marina will offer approximately 460 leasable slips, a new dockmaster’s office/ship store, and 40,000 SF of commercial space intended for a showroom, service bays, and retail tenants. The showroom will showcase an abundance of boat lines, which the BlueWater management team envisioned to provide a year-round boat show experience. Harborage club Fort Lauderdale // Realized The BlueWater management team entitled and designed the site currently occupied by F3 marina in Fort Lauderdale. The Harborage Club of Fort Lauderdale was originally designed and entitled to become the country’s leading dry slip marina in 2007. The plan featured 330 crane operated, climate-controlled dry slips, providing direct access to the intracoastal waterway. In addition to the enclosed barn, the design included a private club featuring a rooftop restaurant and bar, offering panoramic 360-degree views of downtown Fort Lauderdale. PORT 32 Jacksonville // Realized The BlueWater management team acquired Port 32 Jacksonville in 2021. Port 32 Jacksonville is a full-service marina located at the confluence of the St. Johns and Ortega Rivers. The facility features 192 wet slips with direct access to the Intracoastal Waterway and the Atlantic Ocean, making it a key destination for both local and transient boaters. Amenities include a clubhouse, pool, grill patio, and WiFi in wet slip areas, offering a premium boating experience. PORT 32 Marco Island // Realized The BlueWater Management team acquired Port 32 Marco Island in 2021. Port 32 Marco Island is a 288-slip dry storage facility with direct access to Marco Island’s waterways and the Gulf of Mexico. The marina offers fuel, a ship store, and boat rentals, with OneWater Sales & Service as a commercial tenant. It serves as a strategic hub for boaters, providing secure storage and quick access to Southwest Florida’s premier boating destinations. PORT 32 Cape Coral // Realized The BlueWater management team acquired Port 32 Cape Coral in 2021. Port 32 Cape Coral is a 196-slip dry storage facility with direct access to the Caloosahatchee River, Pine Island Sound, and the Gulf of Mexico. The marina features fuel, a ship store, and boat rentals, with OneWater Sales & Service as a commercial tenant. Offering secure storage and efficient launch services, Port 32 Cape Coral provides a streamlined, high-quality boating experience in Southwest Florida. The Harborage at Ashley Marina // Realized The BlueWater Management team acquired The Harborage at Ashley Marina in 2005. Located along the Ashley River in downtown Charleston, The Harborage at Ashley Marina is a 244 wet slip full-service marina with direct access to Charleston Harbor and the Intracoastal Waterway. Following its acquisition, the marina was completely redeveloped and slips were sold to individuals offering the public a rare chance to own a boat slip. The Management team retained a three-story office building, 10 slips, marina management, regime management, and slip rental operations. The facility remains a premier boating destination in Charleston, offering top-tier services and waterfront access for both local and transient boaters. Shem Creek Marina // Realized The BlueWater Management team acquired Shem Creek Marina in 2003. Located on the famous Shem Creek right off the Charleston Harbor, the facility was completely redeveloped in 2007 and offers 210 dry slips. shemcreekmarina.com Golden Isles Marina // Realized The BlueWater Management team acquired Golden Isles Marina in 2005. Located right off of St Simon Island, the facility offers 180 dry slips, 30 wet slips, fuel, a ship store, onsite restaurant and pool. BlueWater founders sold the marina in 2007 to Morningstar. Shem Creek 526 Mill Street // Mt Pleasant, SC 29464 834-884-3211 // www.shemcreekmarina.com Dockage & Amenities Services & Features Shem Creek Marina offers white glove service, meaning we take care of everything. Customers can call ahead and have their vessels placed in the water, washed down, batteries checked, fueled, and ready to go with ice in the cooler. When finished boating, a customer need only leave his or her boat at the dock. The Drystack staff will then wash it down again, flush the engine, and return the boat to its dry storage slip. Pleasant, South Carolina, Shem Creek is known as a laid back, family-friendly neighborhood. Shrimp boats and dolphins, unique shops, great restaurants and taverns make for an unforgettable experience. And now, Shem Creek is also known for the ultimate neighborhood marina, Shem Creek Marina.
